intro: Rudgea sanblasensis, commonly known as the San Blas rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy berries that contain the seeds. Rudgea sanblasensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as understories of tropical forests.
